title: Welcome to My Data Science Portfolio
text:
Welcome to my data science portfolio! This site shows my journey learning data science and analytics. Here you’ll find projects that demonstrate what I’ve learned and discovered. Learn more about me on my About Me page.


This portfolio shows my work learning data science. Each project includes:

My code with documentation
Visualizations I created
What I learned and discovered

I built this site using Quarto and host it on GitHub Pages.




Programming: Python, Pandas for data analysis
Visualization: Creating charts with Matplotlib and Seaborn
Data Collection: Getting data from files, websites, and APIs
Analysis: Finding patterns and answering questions with data







Learn how I explore datasets to find interesting patterns and answer questions.



See how I gather data from different sources and prepare it for analysis.



See how I tackle a data science project beginning to end.



Thanks for visiting! Feel free to explore my projects and see what I’m learning.

title: Welcome to My Data Science Portfolio
text:
Learn how I explore datasets to find interesting patterns and answer questions.



See how I gather data from different sources and prepare it for analysis.



See how I tackle a data science project beginning to end.



Thanks for visiting! Feel free to explore my projects and see what I’m learning.

Introduction
My name is Elijah Barnes. I am an undergraduate student at Brigham Young University, studying statistics with an emphasis in data science. I have a passion for data analysis, machine learning, and statistical modeling. I enjoy working on large datasets and uncovering insights that can help shape my world view. In my free time, I enjoy rock climbing, song writing with my guitar, and spending time with my friends and family.

Education

Bachelor of Science in Statistics with an Emphasis in Data Science, Brigham Young University

Expected Graduation: December 2026
Relevant Coursework: Statistical Modeling, Bayesian Inference, Data organization and Visualization, linear algebra, multivariable calculus.

High School Diploma, Belmont High School

Graduated: May 2020

Experience

Instructional Designer, Brigham Young University Continuing Education, Provo, UT

April 2025 - August 2025
Responsibilities: Assisted in the creation and implementation of several math courses at middle and high school level for BYU’s online high school. Frequent use of mathematical LaTeX and website design.

Research Assisstant, Brigham Young University, Provo, UT

April 2024 - August 2024
Responsibilities: Gathered and analyzed research to be submitted to NCSM on the Precalculus Concept Assessment and its role in high schools. Used R code and Stata to do exploratory data analysis.

Teaching Assistant, Brigham Young University, Provo, UT

December 2023 - April 2024
Responsibilities: Assisted in teaching college algebra at BYU. Assisted in creating grading rubrics and grading assignments, creating course content and one-on-one tutoring of students.

Missionary, The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, Cordoba, Argentina

June 2021 - June 2023
Responsibilities: Served as a missionary for two years in the province of Cordoba. Taught people about the gospel of Jesus Christ and provided service to those in need. Learned to speak Spanish fluently and gained a deep appreciation for the culture of Argentina.

Skills

Programming Languages: R, Python, SQL, LaTeX, C++, Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, Seaborn, ggplot2
Data Analysis: Statistical modeling, machine learning, data visualization, exploratory data analysis, bayesian inference, hypothesis testing
Communication: Strong written and verbal communication skills, experience presenting research findings to both technical and non-technical audiences

About Me

Hobbies: Rock climbing, song writing, playing guitar, spending time with friends and family
Personal Interests: I enjoy learning about the world around me from a mathematical and statistical perspective. I enjoy music and learning different instruments. I am always trying to cook for myself my favorite foods from restauraunts I like. I enjoy fitness and excercise, but I also have an extraordinary sweet tooth.
Fun Facts: I have never tried the Costco hot dog. Every time I go I always get the pizza instead. The one time I was on a basketall team in my life, the only time I scored was on our own net. I have a small pet dog named Ruby back home in Boston.
